verses.verse: A Psalm of David,<WH1732> Maschil.<WH4905> Blessed<WH835> is he whose transgression<WH6588> is forgiven,<WH5375> whose sin<WH2403> is covered.<WH3680>
Blessed<WH835> is the man<WH120> to whom the LORD<WH3068> imputes<WH2803> not iniquity,<WH5771> and in whose spirit<WH7307> there is no<WH369> guile.<WH7423>
When<WH3588> I kept<WH2790> silence,<WH2790> my bones<WH6106> waxed old<WH1086> through my roaring<WH7581> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long.
For day<WH3119> and night<WH3915> your hand<WH3027> was heavy<WH3513> on me: my moisture<WH3955> is turned<WH2015> into the drought<WH2725> of summer.<WH7019> Selah.<WH5542>

I acknowledge<WH3045> my sin<WH2403> to you, and my iniquity<WH5771> have I not hid.<WH3680> I said,<WH559> I will confess<WH3034> my transgressions<WH6588> to the LORD;<WH3068> and you forgave<WH5375> the iniquity<WH5771> of my sin.<WH2403> Selah.<WH5542>

For this<WH2063> shall every<WH3605> one that is godly<WH2623> pray<WH6419> to you in a time<WH6256> when you may be found:<WH4672> surely<WH7535> in the floods<WH7858> of great<WH7227> waters<WH4325> they shall not come<WH5060> near<WH5060> to him.
You are my hiding<WH5643> place; you shall preserve<WH5341> me from trouble;<WH6862> you shall compass<WH5437> me about with songs<WH7438> of deliverance.<WH6405> Selah.<WH5542>
I will instruct<WH7919> you and teach<WH3384> you in the way<WH1870> which<WH2098> you shall go:<WH3212> I will guide<WH3289> you with my eye.<WH5869>

Be you not as the horse,<WH5483> or as the mule,<WH6505> which have no<WH369> understanding:<WH995> whose mouth<WH5716> must be held<WH1102> in with bit<WH4964> and bridle,<WH7448> lest<WH1077> they come<WH7126> near<WH7126> to you.
Many<WH7227> sorrows<WH4341> shall be to the wicked:<WH7563> but he that trusts<WH982> in the LORD,<WH3068> mercy<WH2617> shall compass<WH5437> him about.
Be glad<WH8056> in the LORD,<WH3068> and rejoice,<WH1524> you righteous:<WH6662> and shout<WH7442> for joy, all<WH3605> you that are upright<WH3477> in heart.<WH3820>
